alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued March 13 at 1:26PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...THREAT OF RIVER FLOODING SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING FOR MASON COUNTY... An approaching weather system will result in rain, heavy at times, through Tuesday night with rises on rivers during this period. The heaviest rain is expected to fall over the Olympics after midnight tonight into Monday morning. Steady rainfall - diminishing somewhat - will continue through Tuesday night. Rainfall totals over the Olympic Mountains tonight through Tuesday evening are ranging from 3.5 to 5.5 inches. This could cause the Skokomish River at Potlatch in Mason County to approach flood stage early Tuesday morning. Lower expected rainfall amounts for the Cascades has reduced the potential for flooding on rivers flowing west of the Cascade Mountains. Accordingly the rivers of Snohomish, King, Pierce and Lewis counties have been removed from the outlook. Please monitor the latest river forecasts from the National Weather Service for additional information.
